lead_paragraph: One employee’s complaint, as well as interviews with people who have worked for Bridgewater, describe an atmosphere of surveillance that silences those who don’t fit the mold.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

headline.print_headline: At World’s Largest Hedge Fund, Sex, Fear and Video Surveillance
headline.main: At World’s Largest Hedge Fund, Sex, Fear and Video Surveillance

snippet: One employee’s complaint, as well as interviews with people who have worked for Bridgewater, describe an atmosphere of surveillance that silences those who don’t fit the mold....
abstract: Employees of Bridgewater Associates, world's largest hedge fund, describe atmosphere of secrecy, intimidation and sexual harassment, while complaint filed by employee Christopher Tarui with Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities points to surveillance by guards and video; allegations and filing with Labor Relations Board provide window onto inner workings of secretive $154 billion company, which is governed by rules set out by billionaire founder Ray Dalio.
